item.title: Report X-2024091584
item.description:
Report X-2024091584

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-22
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was presented to the EWRH spill office. Inside of the fiberboard box was a metal bucket. The lid of the bucket was open spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024090570
item.description:
Report E-2024090570

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-29T09:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: BURLINGTON TOWNSHIP
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On September 20, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN2922 was punctured by a nail and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents and worked them in with hand tools until a neutral pH reading was confirmed. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 95-gallon overpack. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums.
